intro: Halophila decipiens, commonly known as the deceptive halophyte, is a marine flowering plant belonging to the Alismataceae family. It is typically found in shallow coastal waters and brackish environments, where it thrives in saline conditions. The plant has slender, ribbon-like leaves that are often submerged, and it produces small, inconspicuous flowers. Halophila decipiens plays a vital role in stabilizing sediments and providing habitat for various marine organisms. Its ability to tolerate high salinity makes it an important species in estuarine ecosystems.
